reviews.title: Fabulous setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The road to Kandalama Hotel from Sigiriya was shocking. Our car could hardly move faster than 15kmph and we were worried that we would burst a tire anytime on the rocky and unlit road. However long the journey was and however tired and hungry we were, we immediately cheered up when we arrived at the hotel. And that was the effect we feel the hotel would have on most guests. The surrounding is so serene and yet, with all the 5* service and fittings you can ask for.
reviews.title: Breathtaking!

likes.liked: — Magnificently designed hotel in a breathtaking location

reviews.title: My favorite hotel in the world!
reviews.text: We loved the check-in. We were greeted and ushered into a peaceful terrace to be seated and served cold scented towels and complimentary juices, whilst we filled our forms. Our keys were handed to us right where we were seated and there is no queuing of any kind!

I imagine the rooms would have been wonderful when they were new. But even now, although upkeeping the place must be an incredibly difficult work, the place is still in decent shape. We were given a room overlooking the lake and the toilets were magnificent. My husband loved having a shower and having the monkeys look right back at him! The beds were comfortable enough although a little damp (probably the humidity from the forest).
reviews.title: Worth the trip -Fantastic Eco-Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kandalama hotel is one of the most incredible hotels in the world. From the infinity pool on the 5th floor which looks like it merges in to the Kandalama lake to the spa baths in our bathroom with stunning views over the lake and an abundance of wildlife. It is the height of luxury and decadence. The stunning Geoffrey Bawa design means the hotel is very much a part of its natural surroundings. We could have stayed there forever. Whilst we were there we went on an elephant ride which was such a wonderful experience. The hotel is also perfectly situated for surrounding cultural delights such as the Dambulla rock caves, Polonnowara and Sigirya (which was sublime and can be seen from your hotel room). If you are planning a trip to Sri Lanka you really should consider staying here.
reviews.title: The most amazing hotel we've ever stayed in!

reviews.text: An orange dirt road winds its way towards the hotel and then *bam!* this modern, yet somehow not, building snuggles up to the side of the rocky hillside. An earthy green, literally, the first eco hotel ever built. Bonus points!
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're greeted by a lotus-bearing woman and fresh fruit juice of our selection at the lobby. There's about 400 tons of rock acting as moulding along a wall, but apparently the whole building was built AROUND the hill...nothing was hacked into. My colleagues mention that the hill is spiritual ground for local buddist pilgrims, so the hotel allows them to come in anytime to pray to the rock. I'm amused at first but end up being charmed and respectful. I overhear that there are special rates and rooms for drivers...something you don't get in the States. Heck, we don't even get drivers...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three days in May 2007. It is set on the side of a hill in the forest around a lake and has plants growing all over it in an effort to make the hotel more eco-friendly and blend into its surroundings, and it does! It is a very open plan hotel with all but the rooms, restaurants and function rooms sealed off and air-conditioned. This means that a lot of the wildlife, insects and bats, fly around the interior of the hotel on a night. As it is set in a forest, sitting on your balcony at night is a no-no, millions of flies and insects get attracted to any bright lights and you have to keep the balcony door shut daytime as monkeys regularly come to visit! The hotel is situated quite a ride from anywhere and is used as a base for exploring the sights roundabout. Rooms are excellent, food first class in quality and choice. Due to the political climate in the country, only a handfull of guests were staying there which made it feel very quiet, intimate and unhurried. Worth a visit!
reviews.title: Loved it
